chapter.title: Host
chapter.para: The Host is one of the principal concepts in Kloudmake, as it provides an abstraction layer that allows to perform operations in the host machine Kloudmake is running against.
Kloudmake currently provides two different host implementations:
LocalHost : This is the default implementation, which provides access to the operating system Kloudmake is running under.
SshHost : This host implementation allows to perform all operations on a remote server using SSH. It supports the use of sudo if a non-root user needs to be used.
When running Kloudmake, a host is assigned to the context, and will be the default host for all resources.
In addition, each resource can have an host override which will be valid for that host and any children (unless a children itself has an host override).
The host is normally accessed by using the current resource's getHost(), or in the case of annotation-driven custom java resources, by using the @Inject annotation. method

The host object provides various functions to read/write files, as well as the ability to execute commands. Additionally it also provides access to a host metadata which provides various host details (operating system, architecture, etc.)
